reviews.sentence: A good deal. We stayed at this property for one night over the holidays. I got a good cyber Monday deal on their website. The rooms included self parking internet and also breakfast buffet for 2 per room. I booked 3 rooms. The location of the hotel is walking distance to a Starbucks and some restaurants. When we arrived Jasmine Z greeted us with a smile and cookies. We had requested rooms facing the courtyard which were pretty quiet. The rooms were clean but a little dated. The walls in the rooms are pretty thin. You can hear the flushing of toilets and people showering. Also there are not blackout curtains in the rooms just blinds. There was mix up with our breakfast buffet at Jacks. The two girls Ashley and Karina were not very friendly and were too busy chatting with each other rather than helping me with the issue. I went to the front desk and Raj at the front desk was great. Super friendly and helpful. He quickly solved the problem with Eric the restaurant manager who was also apologetic and quick to get us seated. We enjoyed our breakfast at Jacks. Linda the omelette maker was amazing. So cheerful and patient taking our requests for our omelettes. We had great service from Pepe our waiter as well. This is a dog friendly hotel so beware if you do not like dogs. I am giving it an average rating because of the thin walls. If you are a heavy sleeper than you probably will not have any issues.

Just a Few Steps Away. The hotel is within easy walking distance to the wharf and downtown Monterey. In addition the walking bike trail along Cannery Row and Pacific Grove is directly out the rear entrance. The valet bell staff is friendly and very helpful. They are very knowledgable about eateies attractions etc. and can provide helpful suggestions. They are geniune in their greeting and truly interested in making your stay enjoyable. The front desk staff are pleasant and make quick work of thw registration and check out process. The rooms are nicely appointed and maid service is attentive. The walls seem very thin at times. Guests wandering the halls as they return after an evening can be heard walking and talking for quite a distance. I believe most rooms have a small refrigerator that easily holds soft drinks and small containers. This hotel is connected with the Monterey Conference Ctr. so it can be busy and often very full. It is a bit pricy but it does have much to offer and they are well above average in guest services.

Outstanding Hotel. The entire staff was so helpful and friendly. We really enjoyed Tuyets service at Jacks bar. Andres massage at the Spa was terrific. Jasmine had beautiful flowers and fruit delivered to a friends room for her birthday and requested that our rooms were close. Overall this hotel is outstanding.

glad we stayed here. front desk staff very professional and accommodating. really loved the warm cookie reception room with view very nice. every thing laid out nicely. only complaint bed too high too hard and comforter too heavy not for the elderly we are 70 and 80. location also liked in and out parking. Free wi fi in room would be a big plus. the room cost enough that this would be a nice benie. it was easy to get to the aquarium restaurants and to Pacific Grove for sight seeing.
Staff was very helpful in attending us. No WiFi included.

Great place for Spring Break. The pool hot tub area is family friendly. The service in the restaurant was great and the housekeeping staff is friendly and helpful. Fishermans Wharf is a short walk with great food.

Wonderful hotel by Fishermans Wharf. The Portola Hotel and Spa is a lovely hotel in a perfect bay location. We really enjoyed the spa services. The staff was friendly and provided excellent service. Thank you.

Nice Hotel right downtown. Very comfortable rooms. Stayed here before came back because it is close to everything. Staff is excellent and very friendly. Close to Restaurants and the Monterey boardwalk.
Wonderful. Great location friendly staff comfort bedno free wifi.

A Great Hotel. We enjoyed our stay the staff was very friendly and our room was very clean comfortable. It was within walking distance to the wharf so many little shops restaurants and lots of entertainment like outdoor jazz bands etc. we will be back again in the near future. It was a beautiful very clean hotel with very friendly staff and near everything we liked to do see. there is the fishermans wharf within walking distance and lots of little shops restaurants in their shopping mall right nearby is Cannery Row. The only thing is sometimes we heard to much noise from the rooms upstairs next door and out in the hallways late at night from the courtyard too.

God Hotel and Great location. We have been stating at this hotel for a number of years now. It has a good price and the rooms and amenities are good. But they always give us a room that is down two halls and at the end of the third hall. The warm cookie is nice but I would trade it for a closer room to the desk. The staff is nice efficient. Self parking is good.

Could be better. The bedding the furniture food drinks staff. The party below my room. Music vibrated the room. Was very loud. could not sleep. Mold on the curtains on the patio. Dirty coffee mug with my breakfast.

Great Location for Restaurants and the Wharf. I stayed at Portola over Halloween weekend. I was there for a conference. The hotel was clean and very well decorated. The staff was ok not fabulous or accommodating. The location is great to get to the wharf or if you want to walk the Monterey Aquarium or dip your toes into the Monterey Bay. There are many restaurants to choose from heading just down the street along Alvarado Street. The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. I would stay here again.
Way too expensive at its service level. the hotel is okay but concidering its price to service I will not come again.

Leisure. We booked 1 night for a quick trip to Monterey and Carmel the next day for lunch. The Hotel had many many pluses especially that it was pet friendly. Upon check in we were given a doggie treat for our dog and two freshly made chocolate chip cookies for my husband and me. Our room was lovely clean and overlooking the front courtyard and the wharf nearby. The shutters In lieu of curtains was perfect. The bedding and pillows beyond comfortable. Our deck with two chairs fabulous. And since we were exhausted we ordered room service and watched the Sharks game on TV. To our surprise the room service dining was wonderful the food fresh and hot. The presentation met all our needs and we enjoyed our dinner. The room was quiet and after the game we went into a deep sleep. So after all the wonderful experiences we were bummed to be woken up by a worker with a pressure washer cleaning the brick outside our window and deck. Yes we were woken from our deep slumber by a pressure washer and were given no notice to expect any work outside our room. When I mentioned it to the front desk as we were checking out the front desk clerk did not have a clue that someone was working outside. And when I told her she commented oh yeah when we have work they start early. So we loved the hotel but please improve your communication between your guests front desk and facilities. We only gave a three star instead of four.

I was disappointed that I was not alerted of the renovation underway. The room was adequate. There were no robes provided or slippers. Room service trays were left in the hallway until after checkout time the next day. I had to complain about a party on the terrace going on at 145 am so apparently there is no security here. No microwave in the room. No food service after 100 pm. The front desk staff was very pretentious when I arrived and we are reluctant to help with my request for additional bedding. They said to call housekeeping. At 120 midnight when I am the only person in the lobby I believe they could have contacted housekeeping g for me while I searched for my room in the annex across the street.

Nice location definitely room for improvement. Was pleased to see great location of hotel understand construction underway but honestly front desk staff not very friendly or very interested in helping to make stay more enjoyable despite the construction not sure why that was considering the hotel did not seem to be busy at all in fact quite empty. Location interior of room very nice Downtown Monterey so much to do Front staff maybe could use a bit of retraining in regards to public relations.

Pleasant. Hard to beat the location. 5 minute walk from the wharf. Quick walk to lots of restaurants too. The staff made the check in process hell. My mother lost her ID so while I was able to get my room key immediately the manager at first told her staff that they could n’t complete check in without proof of ID. That ’s fine I said we ’l just put the second room in my girlfriend ’s name. No dice. That ’s not allowed according to the staff. Okay I ’l change the name on the reservation through Booking. Hey look it ’s in my girlfriend ’s name. Can we check in now. Nope. Eventually the manager came out of hiding and allowed us to check in after my mother showed her a credit card with her name on it. No apology no explanation of why she could n’t just do that all along. Really rude and unhelpful. Would n’t want anyone to have to deal with these people.

Jacks and the breakfast room were extremely disappointing. We had to wait about an hour before we got our water to drink and we had to send our steaks back twice because they were not cooked to medium rare as specified. The front desk lady tried to make excuses. We received the vegetable side dish complimentary which did n’t really make up for the poor cooking. The breakfast buffet required too long a wait for personal omelet and the scrambled eggs were out which I had to mention to staff.
Fair. location. Poor service by front desk staff repeatedly.
